intro: Saussurea sikokiana var. intermedia, commonly known as the Himalayan swamp safflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and yellowish to brownish composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs to reduce water loss. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
